result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Hovde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Financial Gain [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
All jail credit applied to jail sentence in 20CF1413- No credit if revoked. 
21CF1325 and 21CF324 dismissed and read in.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to probation in 22CF237, 22CF236, 22CF238, 21CF808.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to Jail sentences in 20CF1413 and 22CF235.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Provide a DNA sample. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant not to use or possess anyone else's financial or identifying information. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
No contact with co defendant M.L. 
No contact with victims: V.P., D.H., S.H., M.W., A.E., C.M., T.K., R.W.
No contact with Eau Claire DA's Office, Charter Bank, or Midwest Home Supply.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Corrected to reflect 5 years of Probation which was ordered in court- clerical error.

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order to Seal/Redact Court Record
Letter regarding Victims for No Contacts Condition
Letter regarding Victims for No Contacts Condition filed 8/29/2022

9:00 AM cases 22CF235, 22CF236, 22CF237, 22CF238, 20CF1413, 21CF324, 21CF808, 21CF1325 called. Defendant Richard A Hovde in court, in custody.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Richard A Hovde.  Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Court provides the Defense with a copy of a VIS that was filed today. Off the record to allow the defense to review the statement. 

9:04 AM back on the record. Attorney Sheila Yohnk recites the agreement. Attorney Winter notes 22CF971 is not part of the plea agreement and should not be on the court's calendar today. 
Defense confirms the case is not to be scheduled today and is not part of the plea agreement. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to the following Counts: 
22CF237: Counts 1, 2, 3 and 28 as charged in the Information. 
22CF236: Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information. 
22CF235: Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
22CF238: Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
21CF808: Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
20CF1413: Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else, including all of 21CF1325 and 21CF324 is dismissed and read in. 
Parties ask the Court to follow the joint agreement. Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Court orders: 
In 20CF1413: 1 year in Jail with Huber with 186 days credit. 
In 22CF235: 1 year in Jail with Huber consecutive to 20CF1413 (no credit). 
In 22CF237 Count 1: Court orders an Imposed and Stayed pending success on Probation.  Sentence of 3 years initial confinement with 3 years extended supervision. 
In all remaining counts, including count 1 in 22CF237: Defendant is placed on Probation for 5 years (consecutive to the jail sentences but concurrent to one another). 
Conditions of Probation and extended supervision include:
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Pay restitution in the amount of $19,952.45 (includes 10% surcharge) monthly payments of $300 are required. 
Defendant not to use or possess anyone else's financial or identifying information. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
No contact with co defendant M.L. No contact with victims in any of the files. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges. 
All sentence credit is applied to 20CF1413 so there is no credit if revoked from Probation.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Attorney Sheila Yohnk may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 08/29/2022 at 9:00 a.m.

Defense indicates there is an offer to resolve all cases including Chippewa County case. Defense requests to be heard on modification of bond. State indicates the Defendant is being revoked from probation so he will be held no matter if bond is amended. Court advises if DOC is willing to let him out for treatment, counsel should schedule for a bond modification hearing. Off the record: 4:03 PM- 4:05 PM. 
Defense has discussed the right to a preliminary with Defendant in 22CF235, 22CF236, 22CF237, 22CF238. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
